Description: Vessel (sherd.rim); pottery; glazed openwork decoration of plamettes under turquoise glaze.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Egypt, Burlington 1885: "Found in Egypt - so stated and believed by the person who presented the piece to the present owner."
Bibliographic references: Hobson 1932b / A Guide to the Islamic Pottery of the Near East (fig.62)
Burlington 1885 / Illustrated Catalogue of Specimens of Persian and Arab Art Exhibited in 1885 (10)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Charles Drury Edward Fortnum
